intro: Clarkia xantiana subsp. xantiana, commonly known as the Showy Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant pink to red flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is known for its showy, cup-shaped blooms that attract pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger flowers and more robust growth compared to other Clarkia species.
